caption.p: Viral-host co-evolution. The tree on the left shows observed viral sequence relationships [ 82, 91] and references therein) and the tree on the right represents host species relationships [ 81]. FIV polymerase sequences (158 amino acids included in analysis) were analyzed phylogenetically from nine feline species representing six out of the eight feline lineages [ 81]. Asterisks indicate significant bootstrap values (â‰¥ 70%). The branch lengths are not in scale. Numbers next to node define estimated time of divergence for each the felid lineages and for the Felidae/ Hyaenidae split in million years.
